website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung 850 Evo has the best combination of performance, cost and capacity, making it the ideal drive for any home user.
pros: The Samsung SSD 850 Evo delivers great performance with useful features, at an affordable price
The drive is available with up to 2TB of storage space
cons: The drive carries a 5-year warranty instead of the 10 years the Pro model offers
The Samsung Magician software only works with Windows

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 22 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced primary disk drives in 4 computers with SSD drives. Bought 2 Samsung 1TB 850 EVO units and 2 Crucial SSD. After 22 months of light use (1 to 2 hours per day) this Samsung drive crashed with all of my 2016 tax information and programs in it. Local professional outfit could not salvage Samsung SSD drive turned into brick. Took dozens of hours to re- install and re-construct all files. The 2 Crucial SSD drives and the other Samsung working fine but now I no longer trust the Samsungs and I am dealing with the hassle of doing monthly cloning backups. Soon replacing Samsung with new Crucial SSD with higher reliability scores and 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: G. G. Pique

customer_reviews.title: Best Upgrade to an iMAC you could make!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive into my 21.5 2011-mid iMAC. I have been using this SSD with TRIM enabled on macOS Sierra for over a month and no issues to report. I absolutely love the speed and performance this little 1 TB SSD has provided to my old iMAC. Recommend watching several different Youtube videos before installing. Note that it is easier to swap the SSD and the HDD as opposed to adding the SSD and keeping your old HHD in the iMAC. In addition, purchasing and adding the thermal sensor to this SSD is money well spent. See pics showing the weight difference between my old 1TB HHD and the new SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Erik F.

customer_reviews.title: Lightning in a Bottle - okay not really a bottle
customer_reviews.text: Best upgrade I ever made to a computer. I did this for myself in my company provided computer. All my work mates are jealous. My computer literally used to take 15 to 20 minutes to boot with all the corporate mandated software running (theirs still do). My computer now boots in under a minute which is my time given back to me. Other disk intensive tasks run much faster such as video processing and compiling the application I work on. These are tasks that my work mates also see how much faster my computer is compared to theirs. I have told them all to get one of these as an investment for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schnick

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product love these things..
customer_reviews.text: got 2 of these i think and some smaller sizes all of them still ticking.. great products perfect reliability. less heat/wattage no moving parts.. you set the size of the drive, nominally 10% used for keep alive (swap out bad or failing bits) For your most precious data you could set 50% for this purpose and the drive probalby last 100 years. i used 10% on all of them and they are all healthy still years of use. now i put my OS on them for fast boots as well as the most commonly used exe programs and games. The ONLY drawback i can think of is the price :) but that's been dropping over the years.
customer_reviews.author: stumpedI

customer_reviews.title: Slim and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These drives work very well in my laptop. I have seen a severe improvement in performance in my laptop from the 5400RPM to this SSD drive. I trust the Samsung brand for its reliability in chips, and they have been making HDDs, both spindle and SSD, for over 20 years (maybe even longer). My laptops responsiveness to my usage demands was dramatically improved, so I bought another one for future laptops I may upgrade or build.
customer_reviews.author: W. French

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked. Failed in just under 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Failed in just under 3 months. All data gone without warning. 3 stars because other than the failure it performed well. Machine went into a reboot loop I tried to restart it after it hung. I have backups and I'm going to attempt to replace it. Ran the Samsung Magician on it in another machine. It's detectable as a disk but that's it. SMART returns a failed ECC Error rate. I'm bummed. This is my first Samsung failure in 3 SSDs. The other 2 SSDs I retired simply because I had run them for 3 years each. They are used for backup storage now.
customer_reviews.author: Media1Mogul

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid SSD
customer_reviews.text: Update: Over 4 years later and 19.7 TB written. It still performs as well as the day I bought it. ------------------------------------------- I bought this SSD in August 2015 to upgrade the storage in the SSD that came with my desktop. I use my desktop mainly for gaming, and Samsung's Magician software tells me I have written 15.8 TB as of today. I just wish the price of SSDs would drop and be more competitive with HDs. You should never have the operating system or apps installed on a HD if you want your computer to perform as its best.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mannering

customer_reviews.title: Getting and installing it his is like getting a new computer
customer_reviews.text: Getting and installing it his is like getting a new computer. My machine which had become impossibly sluggish and slow, became a rocket-fast ripper of a laptop immediately! Highly recommended for anybody with a slightly older machine still using rotational media as storage. Nicely packaged and delivered on-time for a good price. What more could anybody ask?
customer_reviews.author: Martin D.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 years before dropping dead suddenly
customer_reviews.text: Great drive (though the newer 2TB QVO is the only economical choice) that had great performance before unceremoniously dropping dead one day. No warning at all, went from just fine to the controller not even being recognized in Disk Utility. I did use it as a server in a Mac Mini, which is a bit more demanding than your typical laptop, so I think the lifetime is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Nissen

customer_reviews.title: A good product from Samsung and working flawlessly since installed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Oct 2016, continues to work well. It has really made computing easier vs mechanical drive, in spite of some lousy MS updates:) If you are on the computer every day, it is worth the expense. I use the mechanical drive as a backup in a dock. A good product from Samsung and working flawlessly since installed. bill Update: (2/27/18 (5TB written)The drive is still working flawlessly, but I see prices have effectively doubled. Also a newer version (860). The bump up ssd pricing may push some for cheaper models. Anyway, has been a real plus for computing. Windows updates remain problematic to some extent. Bill..
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good Upgrade For a Reliable Old Samsung SSD
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1TB EVO 850 to replace my aging 500GB EVO 840 that is full (Win 10). I had great reliability and service with the old EVO 840 and there was no hesitation purchasing the EVO 850. Cloning the drive was a challenge but eventually got it working with double capacity in the system C: drive partition. After a few tries unsuccessfully with SW cloning tools I finally used a disk drive duplicator (disks out of the PC) to copy an exact image of the old drive and then utilized SW partitioning tools to extend the partition on the cloned EVO 850 after first boot up. Works perfectly and a big sigh of relief!
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Arledge

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful drive.
customer_reviews.text: Installed quickly and easily in my Dell Inspirion N7100, do get the Service manual from Dell as disassembley is not intuitive. I used Macrium Reflect V6 (Free version) to clone my drive using a spare disk housing and USB 3.0, It took only a couple of hours to clone the entire disk 640 GB used). The performance improvement was amazing, with the supplied 5400 RPM and my build environment to typically took 8+ minutes to boot to a usable condition now it takes about 1'30", this includes login time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Breathed new life in to my older Win 7 laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Breathed new life in to my older Win 7 laptop. Huge decrease in boot up speed over a 1TB HDD that was 7,200 rpm. It used to take at least 20 mins to load up Win 7 with all the services that starts up with the tons of apps that I have installed, now just a couple of mins util fully loaded up! Apps runs a bit faster too. Seems like a lot (150GB) are lost to the drive's recommended software to increase it's longevity. I didn't do a lot of research except that others were recommending to install it. Shut down is faster as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Per earlier comments, this is a great upgrade for an aging Macbook Pro (although by no means limited to this make or model). The install is straightforward, but you need to be comfortable with reformatting the new drive, cloning your old drive to the new, and opening up the laptop to swap them. Otherwise, the job is better handled by a technician. I used Carbon Copy Cloner, a long-available disk utility for Mac, to copy 800 GB of files, which took about ten hours on a rather slow USB2 connection. Now booting up the computer on the new internal SSD is like 4x faster than before, and apps launch similarly fast. The machine runs cooler too.
customer_reviews.author: Louis I. Jaffe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive! Blazing fast - MacBook Pro 15
customer_reviews.text: Had this drive for over 6-months and I have to say it is absolutely wonderful. Tried Crucial and Sandisk prior to buying one of these and the performance of the Samsung is literally 2.5 to 3x faster than everyone else. The disk is incredibly fast and reliable - bought an additional for my MacBook Pro 13" as well then bought the 500gb for my wife's MacBook Pro 15". So I have three disks and all work beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement of old hard drive on desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive was slowly dying in my old Dell All-in-One desktop, so I decided to replace it. The Samsung software made it painless. I did buy a cable to hook the drive up to a USB port. Once it was connected, I ran the included data migration software. It took about 13 hours for half a terabyte of data to transfer through the USB port. Once that was done, I removed the old drive, plugged the new one and fired up the computer and it booted up just like before--only faster. Ran the included Disk Magic software to check and optimize the drive, and that was it!
customer_reviews.author: FuelScience

customer_reviews.title: Easy drive cloning!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I like to wait to review products like this in case they fail down the road, but if it's discontinued, there won't be much need for a review, right. What I can say is that I have had this drive for a few months now and so far so great. I used the included software to exactly copy my old 250 GB Samsung drive onto the 1 TB drive to use as a C: drive, giving me extra space without having to juggle drives around. At first it looked like it wasn't successful, but it was! That was a real plus because that's how I wanted it set up and it was pretty easy! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ozone

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is marginally better, maybe 10%
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive to upgrade a System 76 laptop. Boot speed is under 5 seconds for Linux Mint. Battery life is marginally better, maybe 10%. Windows 10 performance as a virtual machine is noticeably better. The laptop is noticeably cooler with the fan running 50 to 70% less the when using spinning rust. This laptop has 16GB of RAM, so swap performance was not an issue with the original setup and while it should be better, I can't verify it. Overall I highly recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my older laptop
customer_reviews.text: Paid a little extra for the Samsung 850 EVO than I would a comparable brand, but I wanted quality and that's exactly what this delivers. It was a cinch to install using instructions from ifixit.com. Took maybe 10 min to install. Recommend buying the Kaisi 16-Piece Precision Screwdriver Set here on Amazon for about $7, as it has the tools you'll need. Installed it into my Early-2011 15" MacBook Pro. Word and Excel used to take up to 45 seconds to load up, now open in maybe 5 seconds. Such a noticeable improvement. Gives my older laptop some zip. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: to a perfectly fine computer that as snappy and well
customer_reviews.text: Turned my girlfriends POS computer that was barely running and made me want to light it on fire, to a perfectly fine computer that as snappy and well, run perfectly. It's amazing how much of a difference this HD made for the computer. Her processors and other internals are just eMachine type stuff, so even with average parts this HD isn't held back at all.. Saved me $$ by not having to upgrade more or buy a new machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Amber

customer_reviews.title: Dell 17R 16G/850EVO and Rhino/ZBrush
customer_reviews.text: Use an older Dell 17R for ZBrush and Rhino. The 17R has 16g memory, HAD a 1TB hybrid primary drive and a 2T second drive (Dell WHY did you stop letting us install a second drive in newer models?). Rhino and ZBrush are both memory and CPU intensive, not so demanding on the graphic card. ZBrush is very disk intensive, I believe it writes a lot of temp files out. Overall result after upgrade was like having a brand new PC. Night and day difference. If you use either of the programs or similar...the cost of this over a new $2000+ PC was worth it by far! Highly highly recommend. Would give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbynut

customer_reviews.title: Good boot drive for iMac
customer_reviews.text: I have this drive in an external thunderbolt 2 case I had laying around. I'm using it as the boot drive on my iMac and use Carbon Copy Cloner to sync it to the internal drive every hour, just in case. (I do also have other backups... remember, if you don't have at least 3 copies of your data with one copy off site, you don't really have things backed up). Performance is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: The Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but see if the M.2 version is available on your computer first
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but wish I would have purchased the M.2 version for about $10 more. My Del XPS 8900 has the M.2 slot wide open and I could have just popped the M.2 in, disconnected the installed 1 Tb drive, booted from the windows installation disk and have only had to plug the original drive in later to reformat. As it is, I have to do a lot more to get to the second bay for the second drive. I believe the M.2 would have been a little faster, but the M.2 is not set up to run PCIe data transfer on the XPS 8900 but only goes a little faster than the SATA 3 connection on the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Arod MD

customer_reviews.title: SSD EVO - Countdown to Ecstasy
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is SSD's will completely change the performance of your computer. Its like getting a new one...with twin turbos and a blower. You have also navigated to THE one to buy. I do crazy research on these things, and have an entire IT department with veins in their forehead and wear glass bubble helmets to consult with...although I need my English to Jargon translator handy. This is the SSD Holy Land...the EVO is the one...buy it...get out your catchers mitt for Amazon delivery and have an open bay ready. Strap your self to a chair...fire it up...and BLAST OFF....!!!
customer_reviews.author: paxfax

customer_reviews.title: GREAT drive.
customer_reviews.text: Second week, talked my brother into buying one to fix a great computer with serious disk performance issues. Learned that The Western Digital 2TB Green Drive doesn't work with the Samsung Data Migration Software. Used the WD Acronis cloning software from the www.wdc.com site, 270mb free download, worked GREAT. Serious performance upgrade. ************** Just got it today. Easy to migrate data, quick drive even when configured for "reliability" (slower). Drive is light as a feather, smaller than normal drives. The migration software didn't recognize the drive on a FireWire interface; and to go with USB 2.0 (I don't have 3.0). I'll update as time goes by, but unless something tragic happens...LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: J just J

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speed and capacity, at a good pricepoint
customer_reviews.text: I've had SSD's in all of my laptops and desktops since 2012 for Windows, Mac, and Linux OS's. My first two were Kingston HyperX 240GB. I've also used SanDisk Extreme/Ultra Plus, Intel, OCZ Vertex, and Samsung OEM & aftermarket units. I've been watching the price of this unit for sometime, since reading the StorageReview summary. The 850 EVO was easy to install and migrate. I took advantage of Samsung's migration tool, which went smoothly. I typically use Acronis on PC/Linux and Carbon Copy Cloner on Mac. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. ROMER

customer_reviews.title: A must for making your laptop fast and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a dell laptop hard drive. The software that came with it made the migration process so easy. Didn't have to mount, format, or do anything to the drive in the process. Just installed the software, plugged in the ssd with an external enclosure (purchased on amazon for a few dollars) and followed the prompts. Swapped the drives out in the laptop and I'm up and running in less than an hour. Laptop is fast fast fast. And quiet.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Not for all systems.
customer_reviews.text: I either received a lemon or the drive is not compatible with my raid slanted system BIOS. AHCI is normally a BIOS set option but my system has some specialized RAID hardware with no AHCI support. To Samsung's credit their software issues a warning that AHCI is not enabled, however the consequences are not spelled out. This SSD caused blue screen crashes and corrupted files on a daily basis. Samsung support did take back on an RMA but returned it as "fixed" without any further comment. Now it just sits on the shelf, as I can't risk the nightmare it created again without a support statement that they actually changed something. A total loss.
customer_reviews.author: Phil CVP

customer_reviews.title: DEAD after 2 years 2x
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of light-to-average use the drive disappeared from Windows (not the boot drive). Not detected by BIOS or Samsung Magician either. Tried different power and SATA cables – nothing. Tried the power cycle method – nothing. Tried running it off external USB on a different computer – nothing. Just abruptly dead, with no warning and for no apparent reason with no chance of data recovery, on an otherwise good computer with high end power supply and UPS. UPDATED: My second failed abruptly, with no warning, and no possible data recovery. 0 for 2 - Will not buy Samsung again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in, put stuff on it, use it, enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: The price during Black Friday was too good to ignore. I needed a higher capacity SSD for my games and this fit the bill. I can relegate my 500gb 850 evo to scratch disk duty now. This thing is screaming fast and does the job for games and as a general purpose disk. I have installed hundreds of the 250 gb capacity, a few 500 gb, and a handful of these 1tb. I have only had a few die on me and that was due to the user.... For heavy important work I purchase 850 Pros, but for general work and for the price, these 850 evos are a screaming deal.
customer_reviews.author: EReviews

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to replace a boot drive on a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my new laptop which only came with a 500GB HDD. It was exactly what I was looking for and was easy to swap out in my laptop. I have a similar item, from Samsung, in my desktop, which is why I opted for a Samsung again. This model, a 1TB model, was perfect for my intended uses and makes my boot time much faster than using a HDD. I strongly suggest getting one of these if you're looking to replace your boot drive with a SSD. So far, it's performing as I expected it and was a great investment for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Black

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Samsung 850 EVO 1TB SATA III hard drive because my computer hard drive was filling up. The data transfer went smoothly and the drive worked well for about 2 months and then suffered a catastrophic failure and I lost virtually all of my data that had been transferred. Best Buy Geeks tried to recover the data at a cost of over $300 but were unsuccessful. Definitely not impressed with the quality of the unit I received and would not recommend this product. JWP, San Antonio, TX
customer_reviews.author: J. W. P.

customer_reviews.title: Really fast and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive to update my Sony Vaio laptop. It used to take 4 or 5 minutes to boot up and was extremely slow. After replacing the old drive with this one it was like getting a new computer. It now boots immediately and all programs run much faster. The drive very easy to install and Samsung migration software made it easy to clone the old drive. The only issue I had was with Windows 10 not recognizing the drive but once I figured that out everything was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Fast Access
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these drives recently to replace my workstation's mechanical drives. My system now boots almost instantly, and large data files are loaded and saved without any delays. A 512 GB unit is used for my C: system drive, and a 1 TB unit for my D: data drive. With the Windows operating system and all my applications installed on the C: drive, and my data stored on a separate D: drive, my system is now much faster. The 20 times performance increase figure Samsung quotes is very realistic. My SuperMicro workstation has 8 Xeon CPU cores and 64 GB of memory but my mechanical drives were the speed bottleneck. These Samsung SSD drives are just incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Braun

customer_reviews.title: Gave new life to my mid-2010 iMac
customer_reviews.text: My mid-2010 iMac was starting to get a little sluggish and the hard drive was making all sorts of noises. I ordered this samsung evo and my 8 year old mac has new life. With 12 G Ram, the machine is completely adequate for general computing. I used a video I saw online and bought all the parts and the kit to disassemble the computer but the drive is awesome, quiet and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn D

customer_reviews.title: I did not use the file migration software (which did not work last year - so I used a 3rd party free-bee that worked great! ) It
customer_reviews.text: I have been using its 500GB brother for about a year to boot up and for editing video files; but I ran out of room on the latest video project - so I popped for the 1 TB. I did not use the file migration software (which did not work last year - so I used a 3rd party free-bee that worked great!) It is amazing how soon one gets used to things loading almost instantaneously. When I use one of my other computers, I keep thinking that they are broken. Anyway, I have been using the 1TB for about two weeks now - I still boot from the 500GB. Happy happy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve SB

customer_reviews.title: Samsung EVO - Reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 Samsung EVO series SSD drives and have never been disappointed. Other drives from other manufacturers just can't keep up with the Samsung EVO drives over time. Yes, at first, the competitor's drives do well and perform similarly, but as programs, data, and background processes are added, those drives tend to lose performance more quickly than does the EVO. I bought this one to replace a 256 GB EVO, which was full. Though it was slower by then, it still performed better than other drives in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Astrophotographer

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded a late 2015 5k iMac from the crappy Seagate HDD to this puppy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded a late 2015 5k iMac from the crappy Seagate HDD to this puppy. It seriously makes such a huge difference to have an SSD in the iMac. This great machine was horribly throttled by the existing HDD making everything feel so sluggish and slow. Now it's up to par with my 2016 15" MBP and I am happy using XCode along with a few other development tools with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic drive until NVMe drives becomes the standard.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these drives. If your motherboard does not directly accept the newer and faster NVMe drives, and you don't feel like fooling with the compatibility of PCI express riser cards, then this is a nice alternative until you can get a new motherboard. If you are still using standard spinning drives and your computer is a bit long in the tooth, replace your outdated drives with one of these and you will never look back.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive
customer_reviews.text: Great little drive...and I love the utility software that Samsung sends with the unit. I have Paragon Hard Disk Manager 14, which has the capability to migrate the OS, but decided to use Samsung's migration tool. It performed flawlessly. As an added bonus, the utility also tweaks the SSD unit for you in conjunction with Windows. And it benchmarks the SSD and your other hard drives. The OS optimization feature in the utility lets you set the SSD for Maximum Performance, Capacity, or Reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: One Awesome Drive with lots of storage capacity!
customer_reviews.text: One awesome drive. I have been sold on Samsung SSD's for several years and I have never had any issues. This drive is very fast and offers excellent storage capacity for the price. Merging the dat from my old Samsung SSD to this Samsung SSD was a breeze with the included Samsung Data Migration Software. I am hoping that this will be my last upgrade for additional capacity on my server start-up drive. This should last me for next 4 years when I will upgrade my system to the latest and greatest chips. Thanks Samsung for making such awesome and easily replacement drives.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: but my customers love them. Usually the first boot and start of ...
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for this amount of space, but my customers love them. Usually the first boot and start of e.g. MS Word brings a big smile and a comment like "Wow, I have never seen it start up that fast before." These bring new life to older machines, and usually its much cheaper to install a Samsung SSD than to replace the laptop, esp. if the change involves going from Windows 7 to Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Girder and Panel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get to install drive--had someone's sensitive data on it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get a chance to test this drive since it arrived opened and previously used. It had another Amazon customer's data on it and quite a bit of sensitive info... I returned it and got a refund. The drive itself was probably fine, but I paid for a new drive and got someone else's returned item instead. Good reminder to wipe all of your data from a drive if you're going to return it to amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited that I purchased this! I first replaced the 320gb HDD in my 2010 Macbook Pro with a 1tb hybrid drive. I have had intermittent audio dropouts when djing ever since. after ruling out USB and ram issues I read about yosemite and hybrid drives having a core audio related incompatability. This drive not only solved that problem but also allows my computer to run faster overall! Install was easy, I just used disk utility to clone my drive. You will need an sata to usb cable to do that (not included).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The prices have gotten pretty darn reasonable and in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: If you still haven't made the switch to SSD, then you're far behind. The prices have gotten pretty darn reasonable and in my opinion, this is one of the best performance per dollar upgrades that every computer should have. I had an older hard drive that died and I needed to replace it. Buying a 1TB was pretty silly but buy the biggest one you can afford. 30 second boot times are nice!
customer_reviews.author: Traintech86

customer_reviews.title: Solid SSD, super fast and great software for data migration.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great SSD, and what helps the most is the migration software that is Samsung exclusive. I originally had a 1 TB HDD with about 700 GB capacity, most of the space is taken up by PC games. I dreaded the fact I would have to reinstall an OS, and then reinstall all 20 games on the SSD, but the migration software literally just copied the HDD files to the SSD within an hour or two. It was like I originally installed everything on the SSD. This is a great product and the migration software takes the pain out reinstalling everything.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great overall performance and consistent operation
customer_reviews.text: Over last ten years, have purchased SSDs from at least 10 different manufacturers. These are by far the best 2.5" SSD's I have used in widespread overall comparison. Two of these in RAID0 on SATA3 headers is crazy fast, and consistent over time. If you have an M.2 M-Key slot on your motherboard, be sure to see Samsung's offering, it is truly amazing for an OS root drive. Used in conjunction with these SSD's in RAID0, it is truly amazing speed. Highly recommended over the other major and lesser brands.
customer_reviews.author: Infected_Autoreiv

customer_reviews.title: Real world data shows its just as fast as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Came from a Western digital Caviar Black and wow...boot time from 15 minutes to maybe 1 minute 30 seconds. Hard drive intensive tasks are faster, but note that its hard to tell the difference at times without a side by side comparison of some sort. Don't worry about those benchmarks, I see 450MB/s routinely in real work application, and the IOPS mean waiting time is short, not instant, but short. Financially, yes, its not necessary. a hard drive always works too. But to those who are seriously bottlenecked by the hard drive, this is (so far) a great choice. It does what it advertises. Its small, its plastic, and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I got a good deal. Install was a bit of a pain. It helps if you know some computer stuff. With the right tools you do not need the USB3 to SATA adaptor if its added to a desktop. For laptop drive replacement you do need the adaptor. Not rocket science though. I use it as a boot drive and for programs. Storage, etc., goes on the original drive. Then drive can be set up correctly with Samsung Drive Magician. Fast as heck. I really like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Buckaroo

customer_reviews.title: Did You Say FAST?!? It's FAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fast!!! This thing is fast!!! So far, so good!! It was like my 5 year MBP was new all over again. In fact, it's faster than when I bought it. Old HDD was read/write around 45-50Mbps, with this SSD I'm getting 450-500Mbps. That's 10 times faster than the OEM HDD. I'm so glad I spent the money. It was my last ditch effort to get the most out of my MBP. I cannot afford another and I hear they are not making the HDD's in the new Macs upgradeable. They are going to make everything disposable before long.
customer_reviews.author: Matt KTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best PS4 hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this hard drive to replace the 500GB one in my PS4. The difference is night and day. My games load 80% faster then they did with the old one. I have no issues as of right now. I was really impressed of how fast I received the hard drive. I ordered it on Thursday and it arrived Saturday afternoon. I will post a review in a few weeks to give a update
customer_reviews.author: KAL-EL

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Cloned my old hard drive to this one, swapped the drives and the laptop booted right up. The SSD makes a world of difference! I put this in a brand new laptop that has space for only one hard drive so I went with the 1 TB SSD. It makes everything MUCH faster, not just boot up. The laptop came with a 1 TB SSHD Solid State Hybrid Drive with 8 GB of solid state and it was SLOW. I could tell the drive was the bottleneck. Not sure if there was something wrong with it but this Samsung SSD is so much faster, it makes me wonder. I can't speak to longevity though...
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Very good product with very easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very easy to fit in. I used it with a Dell Lattitude E6440 as additional storage in the CD-ROM bay and it worked at the first insert easily well. Did not worry so much to bench mark read/write speeds as so far so good practically well performing. Next is I would want to try this as a boot disk to this same laptop, some say some of these laptop models won't support this big size, but may be worth a try or if someone had tried before it will be good to know, thanks in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Valli

customer_reviews.title: Blown away.  And great migration software.
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the fastest I/O device I have ever seen - over 5000 Mbytes a second. Incredible. The migration software worked flawlessly, I have a Windows-10 machine and the utility was able to migrate the existing 240GB drive to the 850 EVO 1TB drive in a straightforward way - after the copying process, I literally shut the machine off, physically swapped drives, turned the power on and my system was identical as before but instead of a 240GB partition it was 1TB! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Stacie Poythress

customer_reviews.title: and it worked great. I didn't start brand new
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade my Macbook Pro (late-2011), and it worked great. I didn't start brand new, I have a SATA-to-USB adapter and I booted off the original drive over USB. I then used Carbon Copy Cloner to duplicate the old drive to this drive. Of course you could always use this one on the SATA-to-USB adapter, no reason to do one over the other. I just installed mine, then chose to do the cloning. The speed is great, lightning fast and allows the system to 'breathe' instead of being locked up with IO gridlock constantly. I haven't used this drive too long, maybe a day so far. I have used SSD before, though. This hasn't disappointed yet.
customer_reviews.author: Situational Awareness

customer_reviews.title: An SSD is almost a must now. Do it and thank me later
customer_reviews.text: Been using this almost a year now, on my photo editing computer as my working editing Drive. The read and write speeds are great so my photos and videos load quickly and save quickly. It's definitely a noticeable difference compared to a standard hard drive, and it is save me lots of time not having to wait for a hard drive to read or write.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyG

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse fading....update, remorse GONE!!  :)
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but at the time of purchase, it was cheaper than all the rest. Very nice speeds for my computer. Jump from a OCZ 3.5 " SSD (discontinued size and speed a lot slower than the evo) and upgraded to this 1 TB Samsung. Needed the expansion ability. Aug 6/2015 This thing is great. Will bring any old computer back to life, and was easy to install and clone previous harddrive. One thing to note, it will not clone some programs that may be running while the process is taking place. I found this out with my antivirus program. Re-installing worked though. So far, doing great.
customer_reviews.author: JamroK

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed with the drive!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed today after doing the migration last night. Physical installation in the desktop took longer for opening and closing the box then wiring connections. Make sure you get the USB cable as well to do the migration over USB before install. After my initial try to migrate failed, searched forums for help and found these tidbits and the 2nd attempt to migrate worked perfectly. Do a complete defrag of the current HD, turn off hibernation settings to prevent sleeping (will take 2-3 hrs depending on data amount). Simply use the install disk for the migration program and follow the guide. Not sure what more to say other than just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: KevH

customer_reviews.title: the original drive rail worked great, The drive fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a drive that was about to die. I took bootup speed test before removing the old drive and after installing the new one and there was no comparison . the Samsung was much faster from about 2 minutes thirty sec to about thirty sec with the new one. I put in a Asus laptop ,the original drive rail worked great , The drive fit like a glove, after the cloning, the PC booted up with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! MacBook Pro from Early 2013 (Version 8,3) is like brand new computer! High Sierra and Photos scream!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I have a MacBook Pro from early 2011 (8,3). Went from original hard drive to Samsung 850 EVO and now I have a new computer! I did an internet restore, partitioned the disk with DiskUtility like on YouTube and everything came down through iCloud without a problem. Clean re-install was easy and now my Photos and files are almost instantaneous! It is like a new computer for $300...I was going to get a new MacBook Pro but love the 17" monitor on the laptop and was not happy to go to 15". I thought I would try this and now I have a few more years on this laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance Boost For Local Virtual Machines
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this device. On my Windows 10 desktop, I was running 4 virtual machines, each with anti-virus, using VMWare workstation 12 on a single hard drive and was experiencing slow performance on a high end hard drive so I bought the Samsung 850 EVO SSD and moved my virtual machines there. Wow, a great performance boost. Running 2 Windows 2012 servers and 2 Windows 10 desktops on the SSD as virtual machines and they are all very usable. No more slow problems like I had with the hard drive they were on before. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Modernizing a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Solid State is the way to go. I started with a 500 GB hard drive which was getting crowded. This effectively doubled my capacity. It's a great product and it seems even more efficient than the drive that was original factory equipment. I have noticed an extended life of a battery charge while doubling my storage--totally unanticipated. It's nice not worrying about bumps and jolts destroying a hard drive with moving parts. Installation was super easy after looking at free videos on U-Tube.
customer_reviews.author: edincalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 850 EVO 1TB Powered by 3D-VNAD Technology
customer_reviews.text: Samsung now leads the SSD market with 3D-VNAND Technology. Windows 8.1 Pro 64 loads in 5 second on my notebook and SSD warranty 5 years. If you have a problem using Samsung SSD cloning software check your HD Disk configuration. Using MBR (Master Boot Record) may not cause 8196 error code. In my case Asus G75V allowed former HD and BIOS configured to GPT (GUID Partition Table) to pass 2TB limit of MBR. The enclosed software I was not able to clone HD. Check out AOMEI Partition Assistant Pro Edition or free version to set the SSD to GPT then you can clone using the same software afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest  Jones

customer_reviews.title: It is a good price for such an awesome performer assuming you use ...
customer_reviews.text: I owned a 1TB 840 evo, 250GB 850 evo and now the 1TB 850 evo. It is respectable fast without samsung magician. But, with samsung magician I get up to 4GB/s read/write and it is just ridiculously fast (according to the samsung speed test ~500MB/s before and ~4GB/s after rapid mode is turned on). There isn't much else to say about it. It is a good price for such an awesome performer assuming you use rapid mode. Without it.. it is a pretty good performer and can hold its own on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Frechem

customer_reviews.title: Really sped up my boot time and increased performance on an aging laptop
customer_reviews.text: Another Black Friday deal that Kinja tipped me to. This SSD was seriously marked down so I jumped on it. Installed this in my laptop and it definitely is worth every penny. Samsung's Magician software (included) made installation virtually fool proof. If you need to breathe new life into an existing laptop you simply cannot go wrong with this SSD.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for non-retina MacBookPro will add years of life to the machine.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to drop into a 201x non-retina MacBookPro, required a little bit of formatting finagaling, as the GPT/partition table wasn't big enough to OSX, it ships for windows, but once I made that 200MB it imaged and booted right up, adding years of life to the machine, and MUCH faster than the 5400 platters in the machine previously (of course). Keep in mind that it is "short" so will not fill the bay, but is held in solidly by the brackets!
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: about the size of a deck of cards making it great for mini ITX builds too
customer_reviews.text: Transferring data to this drive ended up being a nightmare and the tool samsung gave me to help took three hours to tell me it had failed trying. Still not the drives fault, the 850 is fast, about the size of a deck of cards making it great for mini ITX builds too. There may be larger or faster but this is just the go to drive for a lot of people for a lot of reasons. After a few months with it I have had zero issues and expect to have zero five years from now
customer_reviews.author: Meter_Lake

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SPEED
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my new LENOVO Y70 Touch. The installation was very easy and everything worked perfect. My computer is at least 10 times faster than it was. I am done with the record player hard drives. I think I will turn them into clocks. I also recommend you buy this... Inateck 2.5 Inch USB 3.0 Hard Drive Disk HDD External Enclosure/ Case With USB 3.0 Cable for 9.5mm 7mm 2.5-Inch SATA-I, SATA-II, SATA-III, SATA HDD and SSD, Support UASP You will need to connect the new drive to a USB if you plan to do a complete transfer of your current hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great! But go through Amazon.com Warehouse Deals in the Buy Used Section for a better deal! :D
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Seagate 1TB Hard Drive this made a huge difference in my life! It no longer takes me 7 minutes to cold boot into Windows. Yes... It took me 7 minutes to get to the login screen of Windows with my old hard drive. Now it takes me 17 seconds to cold boot! :D That being said I would recommend you check the used section of Amazon.com for this part & buy from Amazon.com Warehouse Deals. I got mine that way and it's been performing perfectly for me without any glitches.
customer_reviews.author: TechAzn

customer_reviews.title: Easy install on Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my Macbook Pro. Just one foot. It stopped working. Yes it was the hard drive. I decided It was time to move over to a SSD since this was the second Drop/Failure in my life. Easy install on Hardware. Time machine failed two times till I deleted the PRAM. Time Machine then chugged away for 6 hours. I restarted and the Finder was corrupt. Bummer. I opened the Restore/Command Option R. Hit reinstall OS X. 2 hours later everything worked perfectly. Just thought I would leave another method for replacing a Failed Hard Drive. The new drive is Rip'n Fast!!! I now have a NEW Computer!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Fast
customer_reviews.text: I waited 4 months to review this so that I could see how it performed and stood up beyond the initial installation. It was ridiculously easy to install, and it... is...FAST. Start-up takes a fraction of the time it did the original HD, I have an HP Pavilion Elite desktop. I did have a bit of trouble removing the original HD, but that's an HP issue. The 850 EVO is absolutely silent, blazingly fast, and (so far) handling everything I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Returned 2 out of 6
customer_reviews.text: Out of several of these ordered, I have had two defective...not great odds. The product is fine when they work but one 500GB a customer of mine ordered and when I opened it to clone the failing HDD the Samsung SSD was musing the sata and power guides completely. I just returned a 1 TB I ordered because the drive would not read. I am giving them 3 stars because they work well but one more defective drive and that will change. I am a certified computer tech and depend on these products to be in working condition when I receive them.
customer_reviews.author: Space Coast IT

customer_reviews.title: Trouble free for 2 years now
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a HD in my laptop with this drive. I researched SS drives for the best value (with emphasis on reliability). The drive has performed flawlessly so far with daily laptop use.
customer_reviews.author: JP Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Still ticking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 years ago for my daily driver/gaming machine that I built. The software that comes with it made it completely painless to migrate my old OS partition onto this and have it work with the machine I just built. I was amazed. It just worked. Still running without any issue. I keep it at about 50% capacity, but it has seen plenty of read/write. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: A great dependable SSD drive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent SSD drive. I own Four of these . Using the app you can transfer and back up your entire drive from one Samsun drive to another Samsung SSD drive including O S
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this SSD
customer_reviews.text: I love this SSD. I never though a windows computer could start in 10 seconds flat. Coming back from sleep is instantaneous. Before buying I was concerned about the value I was getting for that price, but it turned out to be totally worth it. The installation is also easy and the instructions are very clear. YOU WILL NEED AN EXTERNAL READER, so make sure you buy that too if you don't have one.
customer_reviews.author: Ouns Mouri

customer_reviews.title: It's Samsung.  Bulletproof.
customer_reviews.text: I have probably installed 30 or 40 of these over the years and have yet to see one go bad. Gaming laptop? Check. NAS RAID device? Check. I'll never buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Troutcannon

customer_reviews.title: You're gonna love it!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this when it arrived and it was very easy. The software transferred the entire C: with no issues. I removed the C:, a 256G SSD I had been using for about one year. It was fast but became too small. The new EVO drive booted the first with no errors or any problem. This drive is fast, at least 15% to 20% faster than my old drive and it was fast. I have used it now for 8 days and it has performed flawless. This drive is the best one I have ever used in 32 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Hardly used and stopped functioning!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my wife for her computer. It was replacing the installatiin drive for the OS. We both work a lot and have recently had a kid so we have not had much time to use our comps at home this year. We recently tried to isr her computer and this hard drive seems to have stopped functioning. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: SpendinFi

customer_reviews.title: A Real Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: Not only did this come with Watch Dogs 2 (not preloaded) but it allowed me to finally install every giant game I have in my Steam library. I love to show people these games and now I'm able to quickly and effectively. We can switch from GTA 5 to Rocket League to Just Cause 3 to Mad Max to Little Inferno to Gone Home to The Binding of Isaac.... Anyway my point is that it's insanely fast and one of the biggest hardware upgrades I've experienced. It saves so much time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The included transfer software deemed my WD Velociptor as 'not supported' Because I was replacing my data drive vs the OS, I was able to use just regular windows copy, then tell the BIOS what drive I wanted to boot off of. - If you are replacing your OS drive, have a backup transfer programs handy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitten

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, excellent performance, well-made. Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this drive has continued to perform better than any other SSD drive I have had -- and I have had about 30 in the past 5 years. I work in the computer industry, and depend on reliable storage that performs well. I was not disappointed with the Samsung EVO. Though a bit pricey right now, I expect the 1 TB drives to come down in price over the next year. I decided not to wait, since I needed an upgrade for a laptop I use for digital photography processing, and I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hostmistress

customer_reviews.title: I've never had a problem with any of my Samsung SSDs, love this drive
customer_reviews.text: I get close to the advertised speeds with this drive. Nice and fast, and I have yet to have an issue with any of my Samsung SSDs. They are among the best. I got a great deal on an open box one and I checked its properties and 0 bytes had been written to it before I got it, so that was nice. Great drive.
customer_reviews.author: Juniorverse

customer_reviews.title: I love all solid state hard drives for their quick fire-up
customer_reviews.text: I love all solid state hard drives for their quick fire-up, low power consumption and reduction in operating temps. I have no long term experience with Samsung but do with other brands. I have no early complaints about the unit I installed in my Mac Pro (using an Icy Dock adaptor). Closed the hard drive I intended to replace, swapped 'em and voila. Easy as cake. I'll come back with a long term evaluation if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Allen

customer_reviews.title: samsung number 1 SDD still on top
customer_reviews.text: super fast no wonder this hard drive is rated as number 1 SSD might be old but it runs like beast!!! I have this ssd install on my alienware alpha had some issues using the back up from windows and alien respwan back up don't know why but I guess its so sensitive that it turns out it has its own program for back up, Samsung data migration program is easy to use and its purpose is to clone your C drive and paste everything to this SSD it was fast and easy. I'm very happy
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a Dell Precision workstation 3620. I put this Samsung 850 EVO 1TB SSD drive in as my boot drive. My boot times are ridiculously fast, 3-4 seconds at most once the system gets through post. I did a fresh install of the OS and have had had no issues with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mierzwa

customer_reviews.title: Beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Amazon really came through. Ordered it in the morning, received it that evening. That aside, I needed to increase 4 fold the amount of available storage on my C drive, from 256 gigs to 1 TB. The drive itself is wonderful, and works great...no errors and it is fast. The migration software worked as ordered. I had no trouble running the software and it immediately recognized both SSDs. Hit OK and an hour or so the job was done. I then swapped in the larger Samsung SSD and the computer booted up as though nothing changed. I am a happy camper. I recommend this SSD, especially if you are considering migrating to a larger SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell if the device is DOA or if it's just the poor quality software supplied
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung software can't find the disk when connected to the USB to SATA cable. I can see the disk using device manager. The migration manager doesn't have the ability to check if the computer has proper drivers for the USB to SATA. Can't tell if the device is DOA or if it's just the poor quality software supplied. The install manual is just a set of idiot pictures sowing how it would work if their installation tools were of a usable nature. I've installed SSD's from other manufacturers and the process worked fine. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome SSD Drive.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for performance upgrade for your system, SSD is the way to go. I upgraded my Macbook 2012 to a SSD drive and you can tell the difference in response time.
customer_reviews.author: M Martin

customer_reviews.title: Crazy long reliability...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD almost three years ago and it still has the original speed and reliability from day one. If you are looking for a long lasting and fast SSD, you've found it. I bought this item in 2015, and it still gets over 500mb reads and writes.
customer_reviews.author: maximusfoximus

customer_reviews.title: They work GREAT !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have these SSD drives in ALL of my computers (DeskTop & LapTop). After you have one, you will not go back to the old spin hard drives !!! I do backup to the old spin hard drives - SO - they do work well with each other with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: the entire process was very easy. The box also includes an installation guide
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a laptop's 500 GB HDD with a 1 TB Samsung 850 EVO SSD. The actual space available is about 930 GB. I have been using it for two weeks. The SSD is much faster in terms of booting up and loading applications; several other reviewers have included more specific benchmarks. It is also silent because it has no moving parts (unlike the HDD). I did a clean installation of Windows 8.1 (no cloning) from a USB flash drive; the entire process was very easy. The box also includes an installation guide, the warranty (five year limited) statement summary, and a disk with Samsung's SSD migration software.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: SSD is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Well made product as expected. Seamless cloning of my existing HDD hard drive thanks to the included software, saved a lot of time and "you-tubing" to try and figure some little details out. I have this SSD running not for 3 months and my system is feels like a brand new computer! Best computer upgrade purchase I've made in the last 5 years! If the price drops, I'm buying a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded both PC and PS4 Drives With This SSD
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my PS4 HDD with this. It's been a great upgrade. Games load faster and the system wakes from sleep mode faster as well. It comes handy with games that have big load times from changing levels. I have one in my PC and PS4, and the performance is incomparable. Samsung is the best when it comes to this. Forums say the PS4 currently does not support TRIM which puts the drive at risk of wearing out prematurely. Samsung has indicated that the drive will operate just fine even without TRIM enabled.
customer_reviews.author: Tobie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Using this 1TB drive for a second Time Capsule backup. The speed is amazing compared to the Apple Time Capsule which s a standard HDD. I don't understand why Apple has not upgraded their unit to an SSD. This is amazing. I have another brand SSD running off my router to store Adobe Lightroom RAW photos and it is incredibly fast. Instant! Looking forward to years of reliability after having so many HDD fail.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Dunn

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I finished installing it on my Dell inspiron 17r laptop. It was very easy to install, just remove the bottom back right panel and the hdd caddy is right there. I installed Linux Mint on it, and just testing it out. I was shocked to see that my previous boot up times(~3 minutes!?!) went down to around 12 seconds. Shutdown times are similar in that they are very speedy. I am going to see if I can find other ways to test this drive, but from the boot/shutdown speeds alone it was well worth upgrading the hdd to a ssd.
customer_reviews.author: CrispyStairs

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 850 EVO 1TB Solid State Drive Easy to Install Replaced My Unreliable/Failed Toshiba Hybrid 1TB
customer_reviews.text: After having TWO Toshiba 1TB Hybrid Drives FAIL in 2014 in a Mac Mini with a server running 24/7 (first one lasted 2 months and second one lasted 5 months), I decided to try the Solid State Samsung 1TB. I lost faith in the 1TB 2.5 regular drive. It just isn't reliable. RELIABILITY was my main consideration and I needed the 1 TB. The Samsung Solid State Drive was very easy to install. The Time Machine restore process was almost twice as fast as the hybrid drive. It loads fast and runs very cool compared to the prior drive.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Drive makes 2013 laptop scream again!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my laptop that had a 5200 rpm hard drive and just before I change to this drive, it was taking anywhere from a minute to 3 minutes to shut down each night. I cloned the drive with colonzilla and with no other changes, boot up time went from 2 minutes to just under 35 seconds and hibernate would take about 2 minutes before to 30 seconds after. I use this at work and the laptop is an HP elite book purchased in 2013 with win7 32 bit (for compatibility) and 3GB memory and I am very happy with this choice!
customer_reviews.author: Flower Lover

customer_reviews.title: Solid Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice solid SSD. I put it into a laptop and then set it up to dual-boot. Startup speeds are wonderfully swift. I can't imagine going back to mechanical drives. I'll consider these for any future systems I build.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kamp

customer_reviews.title: Great SSDs!
customer_reviews.text: Quick as lightening, and very capable, the Samsung 850 EVO line has proven to me time and again how well manufactured and designed these are. They really are cutting edge and light to boot. I can't find a single gripe with them except their slightly high price point, but for what you get it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

product_meta.title: Samsung 850 EVO 1TB 2.5-Inch SATA III Internal SSD (MZ-75E1T0B/AM)
product_meta.description: Upgrading your PC with a Samsung SSD is the most economical way to breathe new life into an aging PC. The 850 EVO reads, writes and multi-tasks at incredible speeds, enhancing boot-up speed, application loading and multi-tasking performance. It's more than an upgrade, it's a complete transformation of your PC.
feature_bullets: Powered by Samsung V-NAND Technology; Optimized Performance for Everyday Computing. Interface: SATA 6Gb/s Interface, compatible with SATA 3Gb/s & SATA 1.5Gb/s interfaceGb/s.
Incredible Sequential Read/Write Performance : Up to 540MB/s and 520MB/s Respectively, and Random Read/Write IOPS Performance : Up to 98K and 90K Respectively
Endurance, Reliability, Energy Efficiency, and a 5-Year Limited Warranty
Included Contents: 2.5” (7mm) SATA III (6GB/s) SSD & User Manual (All Other Cables, Screws, Brackets Not Included).
Free download of Samsung Data Migration and Magician software available for easy installation and SSD management
Windows 10/8/7/Vista SP1 and above (32/64 bit), Windows Server 2008 (32/64 bit), Linux Compatible

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,216 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
